title: Installation issue: atk failes due to python version mismatch
body:
### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ spack spec atk
Input spec
--------------------------------
atk

Concretized
--------------------------------
==> Error: An unsatisfiable version constraint has been detected for spec:

    python@2.7.15%gcc@7.3.0+dbm~optimizations+pic+pythoncmd+shared~tk~ucs4 arch=linux-ubuntu16.04-x86_64 
        ^bzip2@1.0.6%gcc@7.3.0+shared arch=linux-ubuntu16.04-x86_64 
        ^gdbm@1.14.1%gcc@7.3.0 arch=linux-ubuntu16.04-x86_64 
            ^readline@7.0%gcc@7.3.0 arch=linux-ubuntu16.04-x86_64 
                ^ncurses@6.1%gcc@7.3.0~symlinks~termlib arch=linux-ubuntu16.04-x86_64 
                    ^pkgconf@1.4.2%gcc@7.3.0 arch=linux-ubuntu16.04-x86_64 
        ^openssl@1.0.2o%gcc@7.3.0+systemcerts arch=linux-ubuntu16.04-x86_64 
            ^zlib@1.2.11%gcc@7.3.0+optimize+pic+shared arch=linux-ubuntu16.04-x86_64 
        ^sqlite@3.23.1%gcc@7.3.0~functions arch=linux-ubuntu16.04-x86_64 


while trying to concretize the partial spec:

    meson


meson requires python version 3:, but spec asked for 2.7.15
```

### Platform and user environment

Please report your OS here:
```commandline
$ uname -a 
Linux west1 4.4.0-130-generic #156-Ubuntu SMP Thu Jun 14 08:53:28 UTC 2018 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
$ lsb_release -d
Description:    Ubuntu 16.04.4 LTS
``` 
### Additional information

The problem is that atk depends on glib (which depends on python2 by default) and in the most current version on meson, which requires python3
